svg.font-family: SauceCodePro Nerd Font, Source Code Pro, Courier

g.text: A template for quickly building login systems on top of Node.js; a fork of
for the allowable options of the verbs.
Millisecond duration for attempting to send emails. Defaults to 5000.
Email site URL. Base URL added within password reset and activation
Locale for server log messages; defaults to "en-US".
Whether to disable logging; defaults to `false` (logging is enabled).
Database user; only needed with env=production
Database password; only needed with env=production
Current working directory; used with `--config`; defaults to
Not normally needed; used to point to instrumented path. Defaults to
Points to a base path for finding locales. Defaults to `app/server`.
Only needed if overriding built-in locales.
Points to a path or URL to which to redirect after users successfully
log in. Defaults to `/home` (or locale equivalent). Note that if you
are overriding this option, you should provide another means to your
users to visit `/home`, e.g., through the accessibility-recommended
approach of having a site-wide navigation bar, so as to allow your
users to update or delete their accounts. Note that this option will be
overridden by any `redirect` query parameter present in the URL.
A convenience to allow overriding the default route name per locale,
e.g., `en-US=home=/updateAccount` would change the `/home` path to
`/updateAccount` for the `en-US` locale. If present, this will take
Whether to allow cross-domain redirects (for some values set by
`customRoute`). Note that the very old Firefox 2 will not be able to
make cross-domain redirects regardless of this setting, so it will
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that accepts the template
options (_, jml, baseurl, name, user, passKey, fromText, fromURL).
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that accepts the template
options (_, jml, baseurl, name, user, activationCode, fromText,
Whether to require a name (separate from user name, as in a real name)
Point to absolute path at which to serve static files on the same
server. Multiple allowed. Not required. To require serving within a
particular non-root path, use `router` with Express' `app.get()` or
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that will be passed the
resolved options. Multiple allowed. Not required. To require serving
within a particular non-root path, use `router` with Express'
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that will be passed the
Express `app` instance and resolved options. Not required.
Mainly for easier debugging. Whether to use browser ESM source modules
where available in place of compiled IIFE code. Defaults to `false`.
Whether to drop the core-js polyfills for compatibility with older
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that will be passed a config
object, including a `template` string indicating the template being
built. Must return an object with any of 4 optional methods (`headPre`,
`headPost`, `bodyPre`, and/or `bodyPost`) which should either be an
HTML string or an array of Jamilih children to be appended at the given
position (or return an empty array to add nothing). Not required.
Used to set config; when `cwd` is set, defaults to "<cwd>/nogin.json";
of lower priority than other CLI arguments; may also be a JavaScript
Two-letter country codes as JSON array; defaults to codes in
The database adapter to use. Defaults to "mongodb", the only current
The path to a favicon; defaults to blank.
The path to a custom CSS stylesheet; defaults to no extra stylesheets
Whether to suppress addition of built-in stylesheets, Bootstrap, and
gh-fork-ribbon.css. Defaults to `false`, i.e., built-in stylesheets are
Regular client-side JavaScript file to load after other scripts (none
ESM client-side JavaScript file to load after other scripts (none by
Whether to load framework scripts locally instead of via CDN. Defaults
Person's name to include as from text in email notifications (password
URL of person to include as link on from text in email notifications
Whether to host coverage within `/coverage`; defaults to `false`.
Whether to show the `/users` page. Off by default for privacy. (May be
removed as an option in the future if privileges are added.)
Used for mitigating DoS attacks; defaults to 100
Disable helmet use entirely. Off by default.
Options to be supplied to helmet. Defaults to `\u007bframeguard:
